attributes.action: Reduce the price that a UK Football Club can charge for a Football Kit.
attributes.additional_details:
There are various newspaper reports that show how much the kits take to produce and 2 of them show the actual cost can be as little as £4.

http://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/replica-football-shirts-rip-fans-7455562

http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/englands-90-world-cup-shirt-3376507

Families are worst hit and parents may have to shell out over £150 kit to get a child a new home, away and 3rd kit which then change annually.
attributes.background:
The price of football kits has risen steadily over the last 20 years and they are now at a level which is massively inflated from the actual cost to make and ship the kit.
The average shirt costs £4.79 to produce and ship, yet they sell for around £50+. This is for home, away and 3rd kits.

rejection.details: This is a commercial decision for individual football clubs. You could consider contacting the FA about it.
